stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: UPDATE - Indicators of Compromise Associated with LOCKY Ransomware
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
LOCKY Ransomware is an emerging threat currently being spread via phishing and spam campaigns delivering malicious attachments or links. When executed, LOCKY encrypts multiple victim files then presents a ransom prompt on the victim machine.
For additional IOCs, see US-CERT IB-16-20079, published 3/18/2016.
This is an UPDATE to IB-16-10045, published 3/22/2016. Additional IOCs were added to the bottom of this file.

marking:Marking_Structure.TOUMarking:Terms_Of_Use: This Indicator Bulletin is provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. The DHS does not endorse any commercial product or service, referenced in this bulletin or otherwise. This document is marked TLP: AMBER. Recipients may only share TLP: AMBER information with members of their own organization, and only as widely as necessary to act on that information. For more information on the Traffic Light Protocol, see http://www.us-cert.gov/tlp .

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious E-mail Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
The number strings in the below attachments examples appear to be random. Attachment examples include:
email.370822995.js email.218970607.js scan_00_391391.zip
--- Sample Email Body ---
Dear Customer,
The mistake made will be compensated promptly, please do not worry.
Please take a look at the file attached (scanned document) as it contains all the information.
Sincerely, Millicent Mathews Account Manager
---End of Body of email---

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious E-mail Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
One spear-phishing campaign related to LOCKY was seen between 9:44 AM ? 10:59 AM Eastern the morning of February 17, 2016 with a .docm file. Details of this campaign are identified below.
Subject: tracking documents
Sender Addresses: cmsharpscan8212@gmail.com cmsharpscan1269@gmail.com
Attachment: cmsharpscan@gmail.com_20160217_132046.docm (there is no further information currently available about this attachment)
http://46.4.239.76/main.php http://electro-cablaj.ro/system/logs/7623dh3f.exe?.7055475

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: LOCKY file delivered as an attachment using various file names, including: "readme_692768919.js", "order_copy_200C189B.zip", "order_copy_200C189B.js", and other various versions of that naming convention.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious E-mail Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Suspected spear-phishing emails involved with LOCKY malware. This email version was seen delivering "new doc 71.zip" "EPSON0008321208634.js" with a payload located at "http://mail-dedmoroz.com.ua/adminka/templ/7ygvtyvb7niim.exe"
